content:
TITLE: Implementing a Marketplace Sale Resource with Runtime Type Checking in Cadence
DESCRIPTION: This example creates a SimpleSale resource that can sell any resource type and verify payment using runtime type checking. It demonstrates practical application of the Type system for implementing flexible marketplaces.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: swift
CODE:
```
pub resource SimpleSale {

    pub var objectForSale: @AnyResource?
    pub let priceForObject: UFix64
    pub let requiredCurrency: Type
    pub let paymentReceiver: Capability<&{FungibleToken.Receiver}>

    init(
        objectForSale: @AnyResource,
        priceForObject: UFix64,
        requiredCurrency: Type,
        paymentReceiver: Capability<&{FungibleToken.Receiver}>
    ) {
        self.objectForSale <- objectForSale
        self.priceForObject = priceForObject
        self.requiredCurrency = requiredCurrency
        self.paymentReceiver = paymentReceiver
    }

    destroy() {
        destroy self.objectForSale
    }

    pub fun buyObject(purchaseAmount: @FungibleToken.Vault): @AnyResource {
        pre {
            self.objectForSale != nil
            purchaseAmount.balance >= self.priceForObject
            purchaseAmount.isInstance(self.requiredCurrency)
        }

        let receiver = self.paymentReceiver.borrow()
            ?? panic("failed to borrow payment receiver capability")

        receiver.deposit(from: <-purchaseAmount)
        let objectForSale <- self.objectForSale <- nil
        return <-objectForSale
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing and Using the Cadence Parser in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to import the CadenceParser from the NPM package, initialize it with the WebAssembly file, and use it to parse Cadence code into an abstract syntax tree (AST).
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/npm-packages/cadence-parser/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import {CadenceParser} from "@onflow/cadence-parser"

const parser = await CadenceParser.create("cadence-parser.wasm")

const ast = parser.parse(`
  access(all) contract HelloWorld {
    access(all) fun hello() {
      log("Hello, world!")
    }
  }
`)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Verifying Multiple Signatures with Weighted Keys using Crypto Contract in Cadence
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the new Crypto contract to create a key list with weighted keys and verify multiple signatures against signed data. It shows the complete process of creating public keys, adding them to a key list with weights, defining signatures, and validating them.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: swift
CODE:
```
let keyList = Crypto.KeyList()

let publicKeyA = Crypto.PublicKey(
    publicKey:
        "db04940e18ec414664ccfd31d5d2d4ece3985acb8cb17a2025b2f1673427267968e52e2bbf3599059649d4b2cce98fdb8a3048e68abf5abe3e710129e90696ca".decodeHex(),
    signatureAlgorithm: Crypto.ECDSA_P256
)
keyList.add(
    publicKeyA,
    hashAlgorithm: Crypto.SHA3_256,
    weight: 0.5
)

let publicKeyB = Crypto.PublicKey(
    publicKey:
        "df9609ee588dd4a6f7789df8d56f03f545d4516f0c99b200d73b9a3afafc14de5d21a4fc7a2a2015719dc95c9e756cfa44f2a445151aaf42479e7120d83df956".decodeHex(),
    signatureAlgorithm: Crypto.ECDSA_P256
)
keyList.add(
    publicKeyB,
    hashAlgorithm: Crypto.SHA3_256,
    weight: 0.5
)

let signatureSet = [
    Crypto.KeyListSignature(
        keyIndex: 0,
        signature:
            "8870a8cbe6f44932ba59e0d15a706214cc4ad2538deb12c0cf718d86f32c47765462a92ce2da15d4a29eb4e2b6fa05d08c7db5d5b2a2cd8c2cb98ded73da31f6".decodeHex()
    ),
    Crypto.KeyListSignature(
        keyIndex: 1,
        signature:
            "bbdc5591c3f937a730d4f6c0a6fde61a0a6ceaa531ccb367c3559335ab9734f4f2b9da8adbe371f1f7da913b5a3fdd96a871e04f078928ca89a83d841c72fadf".decodeHex()
    )
]

// "foo", encoded as UTF-8, in hex representation
let signedData = "666f6f".decodeHex()

let isValid = keyList.isValid(
    signatureSet: signatureSet,
    signedData: signedData
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Demonstrating the Flow Account Key API in Cadence
DESCRIPTION: This transaction demonstrates the usage of the high-level Account Key API introduced in v0.14.0. It shows how to add a new public key to an account, retrieve a key by index, and revoke a key from the account.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: kotlin
CODE:
```
transaction {
	prepare(signer: AuthAccount) {
		let newPublicKey = PublicKey(
			publicKey: "010203".decodeHex(),
			signatureAlgorithm: SignatureAlgorithm.ECDSA_P256
		)

		// Add a key
		let addedKey = signer.keys.add(
			publicKey: newPublicKey,
			hashAlgorithm: HashAlgorithm.SHA3_256,
			weight: 100.0
		)


		// Retrieve a key
		let sameKey = signer.keys.get(keyIndex: addedKey.keyIndex)


		// Revoke a key
		signer.keys.revoke(keyIndex: addedKey.keyIndex)
	}
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Typed Capabilities in Cadence
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates two equivalent functions that work with capabilities, one using the traditional approach and one using typed capabilities. Typed capabilities reduce redundancy by specifying the borrowed type once at declaration time.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_20

LANGUAGE: swift
CODE:
```
fun cap1(): &Something? {
  // The type annotation for `cap` is only added for demonstration purposes,
  // it can also be omitted, because it can be inferred from the value
  let cap: Capability = getAccount(0x1).getCapability(/public/something)!
  return cap.borrow<&Something>()
}

fun cap2(): &Something? {
  // The type annotation for `cap` is only added for demonstration purposes,
  // it can also be omitted, because it can be inferred from the value
  let cap: Capability<&Something> =
      getAccount(0x1).getCapability<&Something>(/public/something)!
  return cap.borrow()
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Cadence Main Tool and REPL
DESCRIPTION: Examples of using the main tool for executing Cadence programs, both in REPL mode and with file execution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/docs/development.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ go run ./cmd/main
Welcome to Cadence v0.12.3!
Type '.help' for assistance.

1> let x = 2
2> x + 3
5
```

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ echo 'access(all) fun main () { log("Hello, world!") }' > hello.cdc
$ go run ./cmd/main hello.cdc
"Hello, world!"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Cadence Check Tool
DESCRIPTION: Demonstration of the check tool for semantic analysis of Cadence code. Shows error reporting for semantic issues.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/docs/development.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ echo "let x = 1" |  go run ./cmd/check
error: error: missing access modifier for constant
 --> :1:0
  |
1 | let x = 1
  | ^
```

TITLE: Dumping Cadence Built-in Types with Members and Nested Types
DESCRIPTION: Example of using the info tool to dump all built-in types with their members and nested types. The command includes flags for showing nested types and members, producing a hierarchical output of type information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/cmd/info/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ go run ./runtime/cmd/info -nested -members dump-builtin-types
...
```

TITLE: Using Type Values for Instance Checking in Cadence
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the isInstance method to check if a value has a certain type at runtime. This enables dynamic type checking with both built-in and user-defined types.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: swift
CODE:
```
let collectible <- create Collectible()
let collectibleType = Type<@Collectible>()
let result = collectible.isInstance(collectibleType)
```

TITLE: Cadence Monaco Editor Grammar Definition
DESCRIPTION: Monarch grammar definition for Cadence syntax highlighting in the Monaco editor, used in the Flow Playground. This implementation defines the syntax rules and token patterns for proper code highlighting.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/docs/syntax-highlighting.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
L15-L194
```

TITLE: Defining Package-Private Interfaces in Go
DESCRIPTION: This pattern ensures an interface cannot be implemented outside its package by adding a private method. The method name starts with 'is' followed by the interface name, takes no arguments, returns nothing, and has an empty body.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/docs/go.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
type I interface {
    isI()
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Runtime Type Values in Cadence
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create Type values at runtime using the Type<T>() constructor. This allows for representation of both built-in and user-defined types at runtime, similar to reflection capabilities in other languages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: swift
CODE:
```
let intType: Type = Type<Int>()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Release Notes Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Release notes and changelog entries formatted in Markdown documenting changes across multiple Cadence versions
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
### üêû Bug Fixes
* Wrap host env errors with external errors
* Fix interface member inheritance
* Fix storage iteration and error misclassification
* Fix error on reference creation with invalid type
* Invalidate references to nested resources upon the move of the outer resource
* Hex encode user input in error to avoid invalid UTF-8
* Use thread safe data structures for entitlement maps
* Properly meter the creation of entitlement static types

### üìñ Documentation
* Add meeting notes for 2023-08-15

### Other Changes
* Sync mutability restrictions branch with stable-cadence
* Rename mutability entitlements
* Update to Go 1.20, improve random value generation
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Version Update and Release Commands
DESCRIPTION: Commands for creating a new Cadence release including version updates and testing
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/docs/releasing.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git checkout master
git checkout -b release/v0.21.2
make release bump=0.21.2
make test && make lint
git commit -m "v0.21.2"
git tag v0.21.2 && git push origin v0.21.2
git push origin release/v0.21.2
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Parameters in Cadence Scripts
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create a Cadence script that accepts parameters. The main function can now receive parameters like transactions, enabling more flexible script execution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_21

LANGUAGE: swift
CODE:
```
pub fun main(x: Int, y: String) {
    log(x)
    log(y)
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Compatibility Check Commands
DESCRIPTION: Series of commands to perform compatibility checking between Cadence versions
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/docs/releasing.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd ./tools/compatibility-check
go get github.com/onflow/cadence@master
go mod tidy
go run ./cmd/check_contracts/main.go ../../tmp/mainnet_contracts.csv ../../tmp/mainnet_output_new.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Untagged Dependencies Using Commit Hash (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates running the `update` subcommand of `main.ts` when a specific downstream dependency (`onflow/flow-go`) needs to be pinned to a commit hash instead of a tag. It uses the `--versions` flag to specify the dependency and its commit hash (`onflow/flow-go@3677206d445c`) alongside the primary version update (`--version v1.0.0-M8`). The GitHub token is set via `GH_TOKEN`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/tools/update/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ GH_TOKEN=`gh auth token` ts-node main.ts update \
    --version v1.0.0-M8 \
    --versions onflow/flow-go@3677206d445c
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Switch Statement in Cadence
DESCRIPTION: Example of using a switch statement in Cadence to return different string descriptions based on a numeric value. The example shows case matching with a default fallback.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: swift
CODE:
```
fun describe(number: Int): String {
    switch number {
    case 1:
        return "one"
    case 2:
        return "two"
    default:
        return "other"
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Releasing a Specific Module within a Repository (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the `release` subcommand of `main.ts` to publish a new version for a specific module (`lint`) located within a larger repository (`onflow/cadence-tools`). It requires specifying the repository with `-r`, the module name with `--mod`, and the target version with `--version`. The GitHub token is set using `GH_TOKEN`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/tools/update/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ GH_TOKEN=`gh auth token` ts-node main.ts release \
    -r onflow/cadence-tools \
    --mod lint \
    --version v1.0.0-M5
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: BLS Cryptographic Functions in Kotlin
DESCRIPTION: New BLS-specific cryptographic functions for verifying proofs and aggregating signatures/keys.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: kotlin
CODE:
```
fun verifyPoP(_ proof: [UInt8]): Bool
```

LANGUAGE: kotlin
CODE:
```
fun aggregateSignatures(_ signatures: [[UInt8]]): [UInt8]?
fun aggregatePublicKeys(_ publicKeys: [PublicKey]): PublicKey?
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Downstream Dependencies with Version Flag (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Executes the `update` subcommand of the `main.ts` script using `ts-node`. It sets the GitHub token (`GH_TOKEN`) retrieved via the `gh` CLI and specifies the target version (`v1.0.0-M8`) for the `onflow/cadence` dependency using the `--version` flag. This command initiates the process of checking and potentially updating downstream repositories.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/tools/update/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
GH_TOKEN=`gh auth token` ts-node main.ts update \
    --version v1.0.0-M8
```

TITLE: Creating and Validating PublicKey in Cadence
DESCRIPTION: Example of creating a PublicKey object and checking its validity in Cadence.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: kotlin
CODE:
```
let publicKey = PublicKey(publicKey: [], signatureAlgorithm: SignatureAlgorithm.ECDSA_P256)

let valid = publicKey.isValid
```

TITLE: Creating Runtime Type Values for Resource Types in Cadence
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create Type values for resource types at runtime. This allows for type reflection with custom resource types in Cadence programs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: swift
CODE:
```

let collectibleType = Type<@Collectible>()
```

TITLE: Verifying Signatures with PublicKey in Cadence
DESCRIPTION: Example of using the verify function on a PublicKey to validate signatures in Cadence.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: kotlin
CODE:
```
let valid = publicKey.verify(
    signature: [],
    signedData: [],
    domainSeparationTag: "something",
    hashAlgorithm: HashAlgorithm.SHA2_256
)
```

TITLE: Type Inference for Arithmetic Operations in Cadence

SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: kotlin


TITLE: Defining Day Enumeration in Cadence
DESCRIPTION: Example of defining a days-of-the-week enumeration in Cadence with UInt8 as the raw type. This demonstrates the syntax for creating an enum with multiple cases.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: swift
CODE:
```
enum Day: UInt8 {
    case Monday
    case Tuesday
    case Wednesday
    case Thursday
    case Friday
    case Saturday
    case Sunday
}
```

TITLE: Using Cadence Parse Tool
DESCRIPTION: Example of using the parse tool to analyze Cadence code syntax. Shows error reporting for invalid syntax and JSON AST output for valid code.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/docs/development.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ echo "X" |  go run ./cmd/parse
error: unexpected token: identifier
 --> :1:0
  |
1 | X
  | ^
```

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ echo "let x = 1" |  go run ./cmd/parse -json
[
  {
    "program": {
      "Type": "Program",
      "Declarations": [
        {
          "Type": "VariableDeclaration",
          "StartPos": {
            "Offset": 0,
            "Line": 1,
            "Column": 0
          },
          "EndPos": {
            "Offset": 8,
            "Line": 1,
            "Column": 8
          },
          [...]

```

TITLE: Storage Initialization Chain in Go

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
util.ReadPayloadFile
util.NewPayloadSnapshot
state.NewTransactionState
environment.NewAccounts
util.NewAccountsAtreeLedger
runtime.NewStorage
```

TITLE: Regenerating TypeScript Definitions from JSON Schema (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Provides the shell command to regenerate TypeScript type definitions (`config.schema.ts`) from a JSON Schema file (`config.schema.json`). This uses the `json-schema-to-typescript` CLI tool, typically installed as a Node.js development dependency. This is a development task performed when the configuration schema changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/tools/update/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
./node_modules/json-schema-to-typescript/dist/src/cli.js config.schema.json > config.schema.ts
```

TITLE: Disabling Address Space Randomization
DESCRIPTION: Command to disable address space randomization for more consistent memory access patterns.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/compat/setup.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
echo 0 | sudo tee /proc/sys/kernel/randomize_va_space
```

TITLE: Path Constructor Functions in Kotlin
DESCRIPTION: New path constructor functions that allow runtime path creation from string identifiers. Returns path objects for public, private and storage domains.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: kotlin
CODE:
```
fun PublicPath(identifier: string): PublicPath?
fun PrivatePath(identifier: string): PrivatePath?
fun StoragePath(identifier: string): StoragePath?
```

LANGUAGE: kotlin
CODE:
```
let pathID = "foo"
let path = PublicPath(identifier: pathID) // is /public/foo
```


TITLE: Downloading Network Contracts
DESCRIPTION: Commands to fetch and analyze contracts from mainnet for compatibility checking
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/docs/releasing.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
mkdir tmp
cd ./tools/get-contracts
go run . --chain=mainnet --apiKey=FILL_ME_IN > ../../tmp/mainnet_contracts.csv
cd ../..
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Git Issue Reference Format
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to properly reference GitHub issues in commit messages and pull requests using closing keywords or work progress indicators.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
Closes #123
Work towards #123
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Compile-Time Interface Implementation Check in Go
DESCRIPTION: This pattern, known as an 'interface guard', ensures a type implements an interface at compile-time. It uses a global variable named '_', typed as the interface, and assigns an empty value of the concrete type to it.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/docs/go.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
type T struct {
    //...
}

var _ io.ReadWriter = (*T)(nil)

func (t *T) Read(p []byte) (n int, err error) {
// ...
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Pointer Usage in cadence.Value#WithType Method in Go
DESCRIPTION: Example showing the breaking change in v0.8.0 where arguments passed to cadence.Value#WithType are now typed as pointers (*cadence.Type) rather than values (cadence.Type). This modification requires changing direct value usage to pointer references.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
myEventType := cadence.EventType{...})

// this üëá 
myEvent := cadence.NewEvent(...).WithType(myEventType)

// changes to this üëá 
myEvent := cadence.NewEvent(...).WithType(&myEventType)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Performance Benchmark of New Cadence Parser vs Old Parser
DESCRIPTION: Benchmark results comparing the performance of the new Cadence parser against the old implementation. The new parser shows significant performance improvements across various contract and transaction files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ go run ./cmd/parse -bench ../../flow-{n,}ft/{contracts,transactions}/*
flow-nft/contracts/ExampleNFT.cdc:          [old]        9  111116110 ns/op
flow-nft/contracts/ExampleNFT.cdc:          [new]     2712     463483 ns/op
flow-nft/contracts/NonFungibleToken.cdc:    [old]      393    3097172 ns/op
flow-nft/contracts/NonFungibleToken.cdc:    [new]     3489     348496 ns/op
flow-nft/transactions/mint_nft.cdc:         [old]      700    1574730 ns/op
flow-nft/transactions/mint_nft.cdc:         [new]    12770      94070 ns/op
flow-nft/transactions/read_nft_data.cdc:    [old]      994    1222887 ns/op
flow-nft/transactions/read_nft_data.cdc:    [new]    15242      79295 ns/op
flow-nft/transactions/setup_account.cdc:    [old]     1281     879751 ns/op
flow-nft/transactions/setup_account.cdc:    [new]    16675      71759 ns/op
flow-nft/transactions/transfer_nft.cdc:     [old]       72   16417568 ns/op
flow-nft/transactions/transfer_nft.cdc:     [new]    10000     109380 ns/op
flow-ft/contracts/CustodialDeposit.cdc:     [old]       18   64938763 ns/op
flow-ft/contracts/CustodialDeposit.cdc:     [new]     3482     354662 ns/op
flow-ft/contracts/FlowToken.cdc:            [old]        7  177111544 ns/op
flow-ft/contracts/FlowToken.cdc:            [new]     1920     640557 ns/op
flow-ft/contracts/FungibleToken.cdc:        [old]      232    5324962 ns/op
flow-ft/contracts/FungibleToken.cdc:        [new]     2947     419529 ns/op
flow-ft/contracts/TokenForwarding.cdc:      [old]       44   25136749 ns/op
flow-ft/contracts/TokenForwarding.cdc:      [new]     7183     172917 ns/op
flow-ft/transactions/burn_tokens.cdc:       [old]       37   31475393 ns/op
flow-ft/transactions/burn_tokens.cdc:       [new]    11361     105932 ns/op
flow-ft/transactions/create_forwarder.cdc:  [old]      733    1636347 ns/op
flow-ft/transactions/create_forwarder.cdc:  [new]     8127     147520 ns/op
flow-ft/transactions/create_minter.cdc:     [old]     1306     923201 ns/op
flow-ft/transactions/create_minter.cdc:     [new]    15240      77666 ns/op
flow-ft/transactions/custodial_deposit.cdc: [old]       69   16504795 ns/op
flow-ft/transactions/custodial_deposit.cdc: [new]     7940     144228 ns/op
flow-ft/transactions/get_balance.cdc:       [old]     1094    1111272 ns/op
flow-ft/transactions/get_balance.cdc:       [new]    18741      65745 ns/op
flow-ft/transactions/get_supply.cdc:        [old]     1392     740989 ns/op
flow-ft/transactions/get_supply.cdc:        [new]    46008      26719 ns/op
flow-ft/transactions/mint_tokens.cdc:       [old]       72   17435128 ns/op
flow-ft/transactions/mint_tokens.cdc:       [new]     8841     124117 ns/op
flow-ft/transactions/setup_account.cdc:     [old]     1219    1089357 ns/op
flow-ft/transactions/setup_account.cdc:     [new]    13797      84948 ns/op
flow-ft/transactions/transfer_tokens.cdc:   [old]       74   17011751 ns/op
flow-ft/transactions/transfer_tokens.cdc:   [new]     9578     125829 ns/op
```

```
        fullTypeNormal
    |   fullTypeNested
    ;
```

TITLE: Scanner Normal Rule Definition

SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/docs/syntax/Syntax Notation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: c
CODE:
```

    |   whitespaceCharacter
    |   lineBreak
    ;
```

TITLE: Updating Dependencies with Existing Versions (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Command to update downstream dependencies using existing versions for specific repositories, demonstrating the use of the --versions flag.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/tools/update/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
GH_TOKEN=<github_token> ts-node main.ts update --version v0.30.0 --versions onflow/flow-go-sdk@v0.31.0,onflow/flow-go@v0.26.0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Dependencies with Commit Hash (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Command to update downstream dependencies using a commit hash for a specific repository instead of a version number.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/tools/update/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
GH_TOKEN=`gh auth token` ts-node main.ts update --version v0.30.0 --versions onflow/flow-go@<commit>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the Cadence AST Explorer API
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the Go API for the Cadence AST Explorer in a separate shell.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/tools/ast-explorer/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
go run .
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring GoLand File Watcher for golangci-lint in Cadence Project
DESCRIPTION: Steps to set up a File Watcher in GoLand for running golangci-lint on Go files in the Cadence project. It includes configuration details such as scope, program path, arguments, and output filters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/docs/goland.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
- Build golangci-lint and the custom analyzers: Run `make build-linter`
- In GoLand go to `Preferences` -> `Tools` -> `File Watchers` -> Add `golangci-lint`
  - File Type: Go files
  - Scope: Project files
  - Program: `/path/to/cadence/tools/golangci-lint/golangci-lint` (NOTE: NOT `~/go/bin/golangci-lint`)
  - Arguments: `run $FileDir$`
  - Advanced Options:
    - Create output file from stdout
    - Show console: Never
    - Output filters: `$FILE_PATH$:$LINE$:$COLUMN$: $MESSAGE$`
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Parser End of Input
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to match the end of input in a parser rule
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/docs/syntax/Syntax Notation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: c
CODE:
```
*
program:
         *declaration( declarationSeparator ) $
    ;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing and Building Storage Explorer
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install dependencies and build the application for production use. Requires npm for package management and Go for running the server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/tools/storage-explorer/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npm i
npm run build
go run . -port 4000 -payloads payloads-file
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Vite Development Build
DESCRIPTION: Command to run Vite build process in watch mode for frontend development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/tools/storage-explorer/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npx vite build --watch
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Parser Adjacent Tokens
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to match adjacent tokens
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/docs/syntax/Syntax Notation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: c
CODE:
```
shiftRight:
        ">" . ">"
    ;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Managing System Services
DESCRIPTION: Commands to stop and disable various system services that might interfere with benchmark measurements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/compat/setup.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
systemctl disable exim4
systemctl disable unattended-upgrades.service
systemctl disable packagekit.service
systemctl disable polkit.service

systemctl stop exim4
systemctl stop unattended-upgrades.service
systemctl stop packagekit.service
systemctl stop polkit.service
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Disabling CPU Turbo Boost
DESCRIPTION: Commands to disable Turbo Boost on Intel and AMD processors for consistent CPU performance during benchmarking.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/compat/setup.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
echo 1 | sudo tee /sys/devices/system/cpu/intel_pstate/no_turbo
```

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
echo 0 | sudo tee /sys/devices/system/cpu/cpufreq/boost
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Disabling Hyper-Threading
DESCRIPTION: Command to disable CPU Hyper-Threading for more predictable performance characteristics.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/compat/setup.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
echo off | sudo tee /sys/devices/system/cpu/smt/control
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Parser Same Line Tokens
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to match tokens on the same line
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/docs/syntax/Syntax Notation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: c
CODE:
```
forceUnwrapOp:
        \ "!"
    ;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting CPU Affinity
DESCRIPTION: Commands to configure and verify CPU shielding for dedicated benchmark execution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/onflow/cadence/blob/master/compat/setup.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
cset shield --cpu 1-3 --kthread=on
```
